name: State_10

timeline_beats.label: Growth as regional shipwright and pilot center
Major engagement in the Great Naval War
Joined Maritime Trading League & Sea Trade Union
Maritime Boundary Recalibration and Open-Seas treaty adjustments

factions.label: Harbor Guild
factions.influence_hint: Controls major shipyards, strong economic leverage

factions.label: Coastal Clans
factions.influence_hint: Local leadership across villages, reserves manpower for levies

factions.label: Merchants' Syndicate
factions.influence_hint: Controls long-distance contracts and tariffs, high wealth

factions.label: Temple of Tides
factions.influence_hint: Holds ritual augury monopoly and port rites, moderate influence

factions.label: Naval Admiralty
factions.influence_hint: State-backed fleet command, decisive in security policy

traits: pragmatic syncretism of rites and trade customs

constraints: No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics
Long-range mind influence is rare and institutionally banned
Navigational auguries exist but cannot replace charts and seamanship
Ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents or specialized labor
Combustion-derived industry limited (no high-pressure steam megatechs)
State must maintain coastal/seafaring infrastructure (ports, lighthouses)
notes: High dependence on imported ritual reagents; supply lines politically sensitive
Seasonal sailing windows shape economy and military campaigns
Internal tension: Harbor Guild & Merchants vs. Coastal Clans over tariffs and levies
Membership in A1/TB1 imposes tariff and convoy obligations
Recent BC2 adjustments produce contested fishing zones near Outer Archipelago
